titleStmt.title: A dialogue between the Baptist and the Presbyterian Wherein the Presbyterians are punished by their own pens, for their cruel and soul-devouring doctrines, making God the ordainer of all the sins of men and devils: and reprobating the greatest part of mankind, without any help of salvation. Whereunto is annexed, a treatise of election, intituled, The order of causes: formerly published by an eminent servant of Christ, and now republished with some explication concerning free-will. By Thomas Grantham, messenger of the baptized churches in Lincolnshire.
titleStmt.author: Grantham, Thomas, 1634-1692.

notesStmt.note: Imperfect? Copy cataloqued lacks 'The order of causes' and text ends with 'A postscript'.
